alert.note: Alert for Williamson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 28 at 12:00AM CDT until August 28 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM CDT SUNDAY FOR SOUTH CENTRAL WILLIAMSON COUNTY... At 1200 AM CDT, Gauge reports indicated between 4 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. Despite rainfall ending it will take some time for flooding in creeks and low water crossings to recede. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cedar Park and Brushy Creek. This includes the following streams and drainages... Brushy Creek. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
